title: 'Fell from auto': Woman claims rape on top B-school campus; her father says 'nothing happened'
content: A 24-year-old psychologist accused a management student in Kolkata of rape, leading to his arrest. However, in a surprising turn, the woman's father later claimed that "nothing had happened," alleging police coercion. The accused, Paramanand Toppannawar, was remanded in police custody for seven days. The institute is cooperating with the investigation, according to a press statement.

title: Audi runs over 5 sleeping on footpath in Delhi; 8-year-old among injured; driver held
content: In a tragic incident in Delhi's Vasant Vihar, an Audi ran over five people sleeping on a footpath near a petrol pump, resulting in critical injuries. The victims, identified as Ladhi, Bimla, Sabami, Narayani, and Ramchander, were immediately rushed to the hospital. Police have apprehended the driver, Utsav Shekhar, a resident of Dwarka, and initiated legal proceedings.

title: Tamil Nadu: Diesel tanker on freight train goes up in flames near Thiruvallur; watch
content: A major disruption hit the Chennai–Arakkonam train route early Sunday as a crude oil tanker on a freight train caught fire near Thiruvallur. The train, carrying 45 tankers from Ennore to Mumbai, experienced the incident around 5 am. Rail traffic was halted, causing delays and diversions. No injuries have been reported, and an investigation into the fire's cause is underway.

title: 'Came for meditation': Russian woman with expired visa found in cave with kids
content: In Gokarna, police rescued a Russian woman, Nina Kutina, and her two young daughters from a cave near Ramateertha Falls. Nina's visa expired in 2017, though her children were born in India. Authorities were surprised to find them in such a remote, dangerous area. Nina claimed she came to Karnataka for meditation and worshipped an idol of Lord Rama.

title: Gill vs Crawley: 'Proper shithousery' – Who said what on final over drama
content: The heated exchange between Shubman Gill and Zak Crawley in the final over of the Lord's Test has sparked controversy. While some former England players like Broad and Finn found humor in the situation, others like Vaughan and Southee criticized India's complaints about time-wasting tactics. KL Rahul warned England to expect a fiery response from India on Day 4.

title: Top engineer quits Elon Musk’s AI firm: Joins OpenAI; says ‘Jensen Huang was right…’
content: Uday Ruddarraju, xAI's head of infrastructure engineering, has resigned after a year, having been instrumental in building the Colossus supercomputer and training Grok 3. He expressed gratitude to Elon Musk and the xAI team for the experience. Shortly after his departure, Ruddarraju announced he is joining OpenAI, with OpenAI President Greg Brockman welcoming him and other engineers.

title: Odisha horror: Student sets self ablaze after HoD's sexual harassment; in critical condition
content: A 20-year-old college student in Balasore, Odisha, suffered critical burn injuries after allegedly setting herself on fire due to prolonged sexual harassment by a teacher. A fellow student was also injured while attempting to rescue her.

title: Veteran actor Kota Srinivasa Rao passes away at 83
content: Renowned actor Kota Srinivasa Rao passed away in the early hours of Sunday at his residence in Filmnagar, Hyderabad. He was 83 and had been battling illness for the past few days. Over a career spanning more than four decades, he carved a unique space for himself in Telugu cinema, featuring in over 750 films.

title: Boarded for Karachi, landed in Saudi: Pakistan airline's alleged goof-up stuns passenger
content: In a bizarre incident, a Pakistani airline mistakenly flew a passenger, Shahzain, to Jeddah instead of his intended destination, Karachi. Shahzain claims the crew ignored his ticket and only realized the error mid-flight, blaming him for the mix-up. Stranded without a passport or visa, he's filed a legal notice demanding compensation for the airline's negligence.

title: Microsoft layoffs: Company cuts 15,000 jobs; tells employees to invest in ...
content: Microsoft is urging its remaining workforce to enhance their AI skills after significant layoffs impacting over 15,000 employees this year. The company is integrating AI usage into performance reviews and shifting its sales strategy towards technically proficient "solutions engineers." This move comes amidst substantial AI investments and a company-wide push for Copilot adoption.

title: Paresh Rawal opens up on Bollywood star's work patterns
content: Paresh Rawal shared insights on working with Aamir Khan and Salman Khan, highlighting their contrasting styles. He described Salman as instinctive and charming, while Aamir is known for his meticulous approach. Rawal is currently promoting 'Nikita Roy' and will reprise his role in 'Hera Pheri 3', expected to film in 2026.

title: Gill’s Lord’s outburst sparks meme fest comparing him to Kohli
content: Tensions flared between England and India at Lord's on Day 3, sparked by Zak Crawley's time-wasting tactics that frustrated Shubman Gill and the Indian team. KL Rahul's magnificent century, along with valuable contributions from Ravindra Jadeja and Rishabh Pant, enabled India to match England's first-innings score of 387, setting the stage for a thrilling contest.

title: IND vs ENG: Trott accuses Gill of ‘acting,’ draws parallels with Kohli’s theatrics
content: Tensions flared during the Lord's Test between India and England as Zak Crawley's time-wasting tactics angered Shubman Gill, leading to a heated verbal exchange. Gill confronted Crawley, prompting intervention from Ben Duckett. Trott criticized Gill's behavior, drawing comparisons to Virat Kohli.

title: Government on Chinese engineers leaving Indian iPhone factories: ‘Apple has alternatives…’
content: The Indian government is closely watching the departure of Chinese engineers from Foxconn, a major iPhone supplier, but believes Apple has solutions to maintain production. Despite concerns about potential disruptions to iPhone 17 production, Apple is increasing iPhone production in India, aiming for 60 million units this year, with eased component sourcing from China and government support through visa facilitation.

title: Six minutes of drama! Why a fired-up Shubman Gill lost his cool at Lord's
content: Day 3 of the Lord's Test witnessed high drama as India's Shubman Gill confronted England's Zak Crawley, fueled by frustration over time-wasting tactics before stumps. Gill's aggressive reaction, including heated words picked up by the stump mic, ignited the match.

title: Rosie O’Donnell: How much is the American comedian worth?
content: Donald Trump threatened to revoke Rosie O'Donnell's citizenship after she criticized his administration's environmental policies in a TikTok video. O'Donnell, now residing in Ireland, has amassed an $80 million net worth through diverse ventures, including television, film, real estate, and entrepreneurial endeavors. Despite moving abroad, she remains active in entertainment and continues her philanthropic work.

title: 'Surreal'! Iga Swiatek finally finds her footing on grass - AND HOW!
content: Iga Swiatek finally conquered her Wimbledon demons, thrashing Amanda Anisimova 6-0, 6-0 in the final to win her first title on grass. After years of early exits and pressure, the Polish star delivered a near-perfect performance, becoming only the second woman to win a Wimbledon final with a double bagel. As she goes 6-0 in major finals, she also clinched her sixth major title while becoming the eighth female to complete a 'surface slam'.

title: 'Friendship is done': Swift unlikely to forgive Blake Lively after betrayal
content: Taylor Swift and Blake Lively's friendship faces trouble. Sources say they are not in contact. This follows Lively's connection to Justin Baldoni's legal issues. Lively's image suffered, straining the bond. Swift is now focused on Travis Kelce. Lively seeks new high-profile connections. The friendship may be over. Both are moving on with their careers and relationships.

title: Gisele Bündchen’s tearful interview: Healing after Tom Brady divorce
content: Gisele Bundchen spoke about her divorce from Tom Brady in March 2024. She described it as the death of her dream. Bundchen dismissed media claims that Brady's return to football caused the split. She expressed continued support for Brady's happiness and success. Bundchen is focusing on her own truth and has grown close to Joaquim Valente.

title: Ayesha Curry melts hearts: baby Cai photo looks just like dad Stephen
content: Ayesha Curry recently shared a heartwarming photo of her youngest child, Cai, sparking a frenzy online due to the striking resemblance to his father, Steph Curry. Fans flooded social media, pointing out Cai's light eyes and infectious smile mirror those of the NBA superstar. Some even noted a resemblance to Steph's mother, Sonya Curry, highlighting the Curry family's strong genes.

title: Tennis player murder case: Radhika didn’t own academy; trained aspirants informally
content: Radhika Yadav, a former tennis player, was allegedly murdered by her father in Gurugram due to his disapproval of her coaching aspiring players. Despite initial speculation involving her social media presence and a music video, police investigations revealed the primary motive was the father's objection to his daughter's income from tennis training.

title: AI171 preliminary probe: 2018 report flagged fuel switch concern, but said it wasn't 'unsafe'
content: A preliminary report on the Air India flight 171 crash in Ahmedabad highlights a potential fuel control switch malfunction. The report references a serviceability bulletin regarding the Boeing-787's fuel control switch, indicating a possible issue with the locking feature. Despite the FAA's advisory, Air India did not conduct the suggested inspections.

title: Tom Brady's 'ladies' man' image grows with Sofia Vergara dating speculation
content: Tom Brady is in the news for his post-divorce life. He was seen with Sofia Vergara on a yacht in Europe. This sparked romance rumors. Jess Allen joked about their compatibility on a podcast. She thinks Vergara might be slumming it. Insiders doubt the relationship will last. A photo of them together is now viral.

title: Aaron Rodgers at war, clash with Steelers coaches called 'a mistake'
content: Hall of Famer Jerome Bettis is concerned about the Pittsburgh Steelers' potential identity shift after acquiring Aaron Rodgers and DK Metcalf. Bettis emphasizes the importance of maintaining a run-first approach, despite Rodgers' preference for a pass-heavy offense. The clash between Rodgers' style and offensive coordinator Arthur Smith's ground-focused scheme raises questions about the team's future success.

title: IND vs ENG 3rd Test: India and England create rare Test history at Lord’s!
content: KL Rahul's century propelled India to match England's first innings total of 387 at Lord's, a rare occurrence in Test history. This identical score sets up a tense finish, with India hoping to maintain the historical trend of teams avoiding defeat in such high-scoring matches.

title: As UNSC president, Pakistan looks to up ante on Kashmir issue
content: Pakistan, nearing the end of its UNSC presidency, plans an open debate on global disputes, aiming for a resolution promoting peaceful settlement mechanisms. While seemingly intended to spotlight Kashmir, the resolution will likely be generic to avoid vetoes, focusing on broad principles. Islamabad will also host an event to bolster UN-OIC cooperation, seeking support for its Kashmir stance.

title: Backing away, call for physio and the abuse: How Gill vs Crawley unfolded at Lord's - Watch
content: A tense exchange unfolded at Lord's as England's Zak Crawley was accused of time-wasting to prevent India from bowling their final over. This followed India matching England's first-innings total, with accusations flying between both sides regarding delaying tactics. Despite the controversy and heated words, the match remains evenly poised, promising an intriguing contest.

title: 'Let Pam Bondi do her job': Trump's message to MAGA after Epstein files episode
content: Donald Trump has defended Attorney General Pam Bondi amidst attacks from his supporters, urging unity within the MAGA movement. He dismissed the renewed controversy surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's files as a political distraction orchestrated by his opponents. Trump called on his allies to focus on investigating voter fraud and political corruption, emphasizing Bondi's vital role in these efforts and downplaying the significance of the Epstein issue.

title: 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan’ box day 2: Sees minimal growth
content: Vikrant Massey and Shanaya Kapoor's romantic drama, Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan, experienced a slight increase in collections on Day 2, earning an estimated Rs 43 lakh. However, its overall performance remains underwhelming, especially when compared to Massey's previous film. The movie also faces competition from Hollywood releases like Superman and Jurassic World Rebirth.

title: Blood, votes and Bibi: How Gaza war allowed Netanyahu to stage a political comeback
content: ​There was a moment — brief, hushed, and deliberately unrecorded — in April 2024 when Benjamin Netanyahu almost stopped the war in Gaza.Hostage negotiations had progressed. An Israeli envoy had been dispatched to Cairo. Egypt and Qatar had brokered terms for a six-week truce. Saudi Arabia had even cracked open the door to normalisation, with Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman reportedly telling US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan, “Let’s finish this,” if Israel ended the war and moved toward a two-state solution.​

title: Odisha: College student torches self over teacher’s ‘abuse’
content: In Balasore, Odisha, a 20-year-old college student self-immolated outside her campus, alleging sexual harassment by a senior faculty member and institutional negligence. A fellow student was injured while attempting to save her. The accused education department head, Samira Kumar Sahu, has been arrested on charges of sexual harassment and abetment to suicide, prompting heightened police presence and student protests.

title: FBI arrests BKI-linked fugitive: Pavittar Batala captured with firearms and seven others
content: The FBI, in collaboration with local law enforcement, apprehended Pavittar Singh Batala, a fugitive linked to Babbar Khalsa International, in California. The arrest, part of 'Summer Heat' initiative, also led to the capture of seven others and the seizure of a significant cache of weapons and ammunition. Batala faces charges related to organized crime, with Indian agencies seeking his extradition.

title: 'For the sake of success...': Shruti Haasan on why South Indian stars behave humbly
content: Shruti Haasan recently opened up about the nuanced behaviour of South Indian film stars and how different they are in their personal lives compared to their public appearances. The actress is gearing up for the release of her movie Coolie with Rajinikanth, and she was last seen in Salaar with Prabhas. Shruti shared why they behave humbly in public.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: No recommendations for Boeing, GE for now, states AAIB report
content: The AAIB's preliminary report on the AI-171 crash hasn't recommended actions for Boeing 787-8 or GE GEnx-1B engine operators, pending further investigation. Data analysis continues, with collaboration from the NTSB, Boeing, GE, FAA, and UK officials. Early media reports suggested fuel control switch issues, but no FAA airworthiness directive has been issued, offering relief to Boeing.

title: Suvendu’s call to stay off Kashmir riles own party, NC slams it as ‘terrorism’
content: Suvendu Adhikari's advice against visiting Kashmir due to its Muslim majority has sparked outrage in J&K. His own party, the BJP, has refuted the statement, emphasizing the patriotism and sacrifices of Kashmiris for India's unity. The National Conference has equated Adhikari's comments with terrorism, highlighting the contradiction to efforts aimed at reviving tourism in the region.

title: 'Sitaare Zameen Par' BO collection: Film heads towards Rs 160 cr; sees jump on 4th Sat
content: Aamir Khan and Genelia Deshmukh's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' is a box office success, nearing ₹160 crore in its fourth week. Despite new releases and mixed reviews, the sports drama, directed by RS Prasanna, is holding strong. The film features ten neurodivergent actors, adding authenticity to the story of a suspended coach training a team of players with disabilities.

title: 'Show some f**ing b**s': Shubman Gill shouts at Zak Crawley
content: Day 3 of the India vs. England Test at Lord's was filled with drama. After India posted 387, Jasprit Bumrah's fiery spell against Zak Crawley ignited tensions, with Shubman Gill's outburst adding fuel. Sarcastic applause followed a blow to Crawley, intensifying the atmosphere.

title: Age just a number: Senior citizens crack NEET, apply for medical seats in Tamil Nadu
content: In Tamil Nadu, a surprising trend has emerged as several senior citizens, including lawyers, cleared NEET and applied for MBBS admissions. Officials are now grappling with the implications of older individuals competing for medical seats, particularly under the 7.5% reservation for government school students.

title: Emotional effect real, support available for you; Air India to pilots after AAIB report
content: Following the release of the preliminary report on the June 12 Ahmedabad Dreamliner crash, Air India will conduct a detailed review session for its pilots. Captain Manish Uppal urged pilots to carefully examine the report, emphasizing its role in preventing future tragedies.

title: Female cheetah dies of injuries at Kuno
content: Nabha, an 8-year-old Namibian cheetah, has died at Kuno National Park due to severe injuries sustained during a hunting attempt within her enclosure. Despite a week of treatment, she succumbed to fractures in her left ulna and fibula. The cheetah population at Kuno is now 26, with all other cheetahs reported to be healthy and adapting well.

title: 'Became CJI as someone saw something in me'
content: CJI B R Gavai emphasized the crucial role of senior legal professionals in nurturing young talent, acknowledging that his own success stemmed from mentorship and support. He urged judges and lawyers to mentor aspiring lawyers, highlighting it as a responsibility rather than a favor. Gavai also cautioned against overvaluing foreign law degrees as indicators of capability.

title: 'Raises more questions': What experts said on Air India crash report; fuel switch row deepens
content: A preliminary report on the Air India AI171 crash that killed 260 people reveals both engines failed shortly after takeoff due to a fuel cutoff. The Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau's report highlights a puzzling exchange between pilots and raises questions about technical malfunction or human error.

title: Juvenile gets 20 years in 2017 gang rape case after trial as adult
content: In Budaun, a juvenile has been sentenced to 20 years in prison for the 2017 gang rape of a 14-year-old girl. Tried as an adult, he pleaded not guilty, unlike his co-accused who confessed in juvenile court. The survivor's testimony, medical report, and co-accused confessions led to the conviction, with the court imposing a fine of Rs 50,000.

title: Nations with worse rights record target India: Justice Kant
content: Justice Surya Kant, the future CJI, addressed the global community, highlighting India's strong human rights record. He criticized nations with strict immigration policies and excessive force, suggesting their human rights critiques lack self-reflection. He also promoted India as a reliable and cost-effective arbitration destination for foreign firms, emphasizing the nation's commitment to the rule of law and an independent judiciary.

title: Air India crash: What AAIB report confirms, what it rules out, what still remains unanswered
content: A preliminary report on the Air India Flight 171 crash in Ahmedabad reveals a dual engine failure caused by fuel cutoff switches being inexplicably moved. Cockpit recordings capture confusion among the pilots, with one denying responsibility. Despite engine restarts, the plane crashed shortly after takeoff.

title: Give fee information on site or face action: National Medical Commission to colleges
content: The National Medical Commission (NMC) has mandated that all medical colleges disclose their complete course-wise fee structure and stipend details for interns and residents on their websites. To ensure compliance and facilitate monitoring, the NMC has created a Google form for institutions to submit the required information. Colleges failing to adhere to this directive may face punitive actions.

title: 'Beyond understanding': NDA-ally Chirag sends new message to Nitish govt
content: Union Minister Chirag Paswan criticized Bihar's deteriorating law and order following a series of murders, including a hospital worker in Nalanda. Political tensions escalated as Congress leaders blamed the central government, while the ruling coalition pointed fingers at the opposition.

title: 'Maine kanya vadh kar diya hai': What Radhika Yadav's father said after killing her
content: Deepak Yadav fatally shot his daughter, Radhika, a former tennis player, following disagreements over her coaching and career aspirations. He confessed to the crime, expressing remorse and a desire for punishment, citing societal pressures and disapproval of her earning money through tennis coaching as motives. The investigation continues, focusing on the father's objections, while dismissing other potential factors.

title: Browns' Judkins facing domestic violence charge
content: Cleveland Browns rookie running back Quinshon Judkins was arrested on a domestic violence and battery charge in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, on Saturday, according to the Fort Lauderdale Police Department and Broward County arrest records.

title: Sources: Anthony bought out, looks to join Bucks
content: Cole Anthony agreed to a contract buyout with the Memphis Grizzlies, and the 25-year-old guard plans to sign with the Milwaukee Bucks after he clears waivers, sources told ESPN on Saturday night.

title: Stevenson keeps belt with decision win vs. Zepeda
content: Shakur Stevenson couldn't score a knockout blow against William Zepeda but put together a boxing clinic to retain his WBC lightweight title with a unanimous decision Saturday night in Queens, N.Y.

title: Messi extends historic streak with 2 more goals
content: Lionel Messi extended his MLS-record streak of multigoal games as he scored twice in Inter Miami's win over Nashville.

title: Sharpe, 3-time Pro Bowl LT for Cardinals, dies
content: Longtime Cardinals left tackle Luis Sharpe, a three-time Pro Bowler who spent his entire 13-year NFL career with the franchise, has died at age 65.

title: Harper's Spurs top Flagg's Mavs at summer league
content: The top two choices in the NBA draft, Cooper Flagg and Dylan Harper, faced off Saturday in the NBA summer league, and flashed an enticing view of what might be on the horizon next season during the San Antonio Spurs' 76-69 win over the Dallas Mavericks.

title: Roberts, Murphy back Misiorowski ASG selection
content: The addition of Milwaukee Brewers pitcher Jacob Misiorowski to the NL All-Star team drew mixed reactions around baseball, but on Saturday, NL manager Dave Roberts supported the selection, adding the rookie should bring "some more excitement" to the game.

title: FIFA, players agree to mandatory rest periods
content: Player unions secured a victory in their battle for mandatory rest periods after a meeting in New York with FIFA president Gianni Infantino.

title: 🛑 Why LeBron, Lakers are stuck in limbo
content: For months, publicly and privately, the Lakers have been signaling their desire to begin the Luka Doncic era in Los Angeles, even if it meant ending the LeBron James one.

title: MLB mock draft 3.0: Kiley McDaniel predicts the first two rounds
content: The MLB draft is Sunday! And this year, the drama starts with the Washington Nationals at the No. 1 pick.

title: How Iga Swiatek defied all expectations to win her first Wimbledon title
content: After an early exit at her favorite Slam last month, Swiatek rebounded on her worst surface to take the Wimbledon title.

title: Sinner vs. Alcaraz: Who will win the Wimbledon title?
content: Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner will face off for the second time in a major final, at Wimbledon on Sunday. Our experts make predictions.

title: Transfer rumors, news: USMNT's Pulisic wanted by Ronaldo's Al Nassr
content: Al Nassr are looking at a summer move for AC Milan's United States star Christian Pulisic. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Tillman to Leverkusen: Can USMNT star fill void left by Wirtz?
content: Malik Tillman is coming off a career year and Bayer Leverkusen are in transition. Is this a perfect match?

title: The unstoppable power of Jim Abbott's legacy
content: Abbott, who pitched in the majors with one hand, remains a beacon for families with unique struggles.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Sweden demolish Germany, Poland make history
content: Sweden topped Group C with a commanding win over Germany. Here's everything you need to know about Euro 2025 action.

title: USMNT star Tillman joins Leverkusen from PSV
content: United States men's national team midfielder Malik Tillman has completed a move to Bayer Leverkusen, the club announced Saturday.

title: Infantino: Covered stadiums to be used at '26 WC
content: FIFA President Gianni Infantino said stadiums with roofs will be used to ease concerns over severe weather at the 2026 Men's World Cup.

title: Liverpool retire No. 20 jersey in memory of Jota
content: Liverpool have confirmed they will retire the No. 20 shirt in honour of forward Diogo Jota, who died in a car crash alongside brother André Silva last week.

title: LaLiga boss rejects Madrid plea to extend break
content: LaLiga president Javier Tebas rejected Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois' plea to postpone the team's 2025-26 league opener to give players time to rest following the Club World Cup.

title: Louis van Gaal 'no longer bothered by cancer'
content: Louis van Gaal has said he is "no longer bothered by cancer" and is keen for a return to the higher levels of the game.

title: PSG's 'team of stars' look to cap historic season
content: Luis Enrique said Paris Saint-Germain's "team of stars" can deliver the "icing on the cake" for their incredible season in the FIFA Club World Cup final.

title: Don't Look Back in Anger: Pep booed at Oasis gig
content: Some Oasis fans weren't quite "mad fer it" when the band dedicated a song to Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola at their homecoming concert in Manchester.

title: Garber: CWC a milestone moment for U.S. soccer
content: As the Club World Cup draws to a close on Sunday, North America's soccer community is celebrating what Major League Soccer Commissioner Don Garber calls a breakthrough moment for the region.

title: How Chelsea, PSG compare; who will win?
content: One of Chelsea or PSG will win the first expanded Club World Cup on Sunday, so how do they match up ahead of the final?

title: Who are the NFL's best interior offensive linemen? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: Execs, coaches and scouts from around the NFL ranked their top 10 interior offensive linemen in our annual summer series.

title: Why the NFLPA mess should matter to football fans
content: It behooves the competitive balance of the NFL to have strong ownership and strong labor, Wetzel writes.

title: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 23 five-stars in the Class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: 'Bigg Boss' Fame Abdu Rozik Arrested At Dubai Airport On Theft Allegations
content: Tajikistani singer and social media influencer Abdu Rozik was arrested at Dubai International Airport on Saturday on allegations of theft.

title: "I Should Be Hanged," Radhika Yadav's Father Told His Brother
content: Tennis player Radhika Yadav's father Deepak Yadav has asked for the most stringent punishment and said he should be hanged for killing his daughter earlier this week, a family relative has said.

title: "Parents Shamed Her Over Shorts, Talking To Boys": Radhika Yadav's Friend
content: Radhika Yadav, a 25-year-old tennis player in Gurugram was allegedly shot dead by her father Deepak Yadav. Three days after the chilling murder, one of Radhika's friends shared an emotional video on social media and made some explosive claims.

title: Should Fuel Switches Have Been Changed? Expert's Take On Air India Crash
content: An advisory had been issued by the Federal Aviation Authority (FAA) in 2018 about fuel cutoff switches moving without any force after they get worn out and, in hindsight, it would have been better if changing them had been made mandatory.

title: Massive Fire Erupts On Goods Train Carrying Diesel In Tamil Nadu
content: A major fire broke out on four wagons of a goods train carrying diesel near the Tiruvallur railway station around 5:30 am this morning triggering panic in the surrounding areas.

title: SpaceX To Invest $2 Billion In Musk's xAI Startup: Report
content: SpaceX has committed $2 billion to xAI as part of a $5 billion equity round, deepening the ties between tech billionaire Elon Musk's ventures as his artificial intelligence startup races to compete with rival OpenAI, a report said.

title: Lahore Man Wanted To Fly To Karachi. Pak Airline Sends Him To Saudi Instead
content: A passenger has sent a legal notice to a private airline after being mistakenly flown from Lahore to Jeddah instead of Karachi.

title: "A Guy Who Never Dies": Trump Urges MAGA Base To End 'Epstein Files' Obsession
content: President Donald Trump urged his political base on Saturday to stop attacking his administration over files related to notorious sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, a case that has become an obsession for conspiracy theorists.

title: Trump Defends Attorney General Amid Backlash Over Epstein Files
content: US President Donald Trump defended Attorney General Pam Bondi on Saturday amid backlash against her from some of Trump's supporters over how the Justice Department handled the investigation into the death of accused sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Tripura Teen Goes Missing In Delhi, Chief Minister Manik Saha Intervenes
content: Sneha, a student of Atma Ram Sanatan Dharma College, Delhi University, was last in contact with her family on July 7.

title: Fairy-Tale Palaces That Inspired Disney's Castles Get World Heritage Status
content: Bavaria's fairy-tale royal castles, including Neuschwanstein, Herrenchiemsee and Linderhof, have been added to the UNESCO World Heritage list, officials said on Saturday.

title: Odisha Government Forms Probe Team After Student's Self-Immolation Bid
content: The Odisha Government's higher education department has ordered a probe regarding the Balasore incident where allegedly harassed by her head of department, a girl student set herself ablaze at a college.

title: All About Varun Mohan, The Windsurf CEO Hired By Google To Strengthen Its AI
content: Varun Mohan, MIT-educated co-founder of AI startup Windsurf, was hired by Google in a move that came after OpenAI’s reported bid to acquire the company.

title: Drunk Audi Driver Runs Over 5 Sleeping On Footpath In Delhi, Arrested: Cops
content: A drunk driver of an Audi car allegedly ran over five people, including two couples and an eight-year-old girl, injuring them while they were sleeping on a footpath near Shiva Camp in southwest Delhi's Vasant Vihar area, an official said on Saturday.

title: Minister Alleges 1,000 Non-Hindus On Tirumala Temple Board's Payroll, Seeks Action
content: Union Minister and prominent Telangana BJP leader, Bandi Sanjay Kumar, has ignited a fresh controversy by alleging that more than 1,000 non-Hindus are currently employed within the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams.

title: Curfew In Arunachal Town After Mob Killed Teenager Accused Of Sex Abuse
content: A curfew has been imposed in Roing town of Lower Dibang Valley in Arunachal Pradesh after a teenager was dragged out of a police station and lynched for allegedly sexually assaulting minor girls.

title: Inspired By 'Drishyam', Man Kills Mother-In-Law For Insurance Payout: Cops
content: In a chilling case that the police say may have been inspired by the crime thriller 'Drishyam', a son-in-law in Telangana's Siddipet district has been arrested for allegedly murdering his 60-year-old mother-in-law to claim Rs 60 lakh in insurance.

title: Cracks In Rs 500-Crore Project? Airport Wall Collapses After Rain In Madhya Pradesh's Rewa
content: A section of the boundary wall of the newly-constructed Rewa Airport in Madhya Pradesh, built at a cost of Rs 500 crore, has collapsed barely months after completion

title: In Madhya Pradesh's Nishad Outreach, A BJP Push For Bihar Polls
content: Aiming to hit two targets with one arrow ahead of the Bihar elections, the BJP-led Madhya Pradesh government on Saturday organised its first-ever event named after Nishadraj, a friend of Lord Ram in the Ramayana.

title: Delhi To Waive Late Fee On Water Bills As Dues Cross Rs 1.42 Lakh Crore
content: In a major relief measure for Delhi residents, the government is preparing to waive 100 per cent of the late payment surcharge on pending domestic water bills.

title: 'I love a pretty shoe': Paige Bueckers says Azzi Fudd helps her pick game sneakers
content: Paige Bueckers has 11 points in the Wings' 102-72 loss to the Phoenix Mercury . she wore the Devin Booker signature shoe . her former teammate Azzi Fudd helps her pick out her game-day sneakers .

title: Who dropped out of the top 10? Players eyeing a bounce-back at TE, RB and Edge
content: sportsmail's survey of the top 10 players at every position is unveiled . we'll collect those names here as the top-10 for each position is revealed . more than 70 voters submitted a ballot on at least one position, and in many cases all positions .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Katie Taylor fought the right fight at the right time against Amanda Serrano
content: women's boxing may not have the stage it had on Netflix in front of millions of viewers . she fought serrano's fight for the first 20 rounds of their trilogy . her coach and promoter advised her the first two times to not make the fights more difficult .

title: The 30 players you need to pay attention to in summer league, from Atlanta to Washington
content: the 11-day tournament begins Thursday and runs through July 20 . the event will be headlined by the fresh faces of the 2025 draft class . top 2025 picks Cooper Flagg, Dylan Harper and VJ Edgecombe will all be in action .

title: Fight results: Shakur beats Zepeda, Sheeraz stops Berlanga
content: Shakur Stevenson beats William Zepeda 33-1, 27 KOs in a boxing clinic . two scorecards favored Stevenson 118-110 and one judge had it 119-109 . the lightweight champion retained his title with a unanimous decision .

title: Patrick Mahomes in Round 11? WRs, RBs prioritized in 8-team mock draft
content: some fantasy football mock drafts are for leagues with 10 or 12 teams . fewer starting slots than in larger leagues, there are notable differences in draft approach . most obvious comes at quarterback, where only five were selected in the first 10 rounds .

title: Drake reveals Shai Gilgeous-Alexander tattoo, covers up LeBron James tattoo amid tension
content: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander appears to be taking leBron James ' spot, but not on the court . he previously had a tattoo of the Los Angeles Lakers superstar's St. Vincent/St. Mary's jersey on the outside of his left arm with the no. 23 .

title: Former Foreign Secretary Shringla, Ujjwal Nikam, C. Sadanandan Master, and Meenakshi Jain nominated to Rajya Sabha
content: The President of India nominates 12 persons as her nominees to the Rajya Sabha, four seats are currently vacant.

title: Amarnath Yatra: Fresh batch of over 7,000 pilgrims leave from Jammu base camp
content: The 38-day annual pilgrimage to the 3,880-metre high cave shrine started from the two routes on July 3 and is scheduled to end on August 9

title: Four sustain injuries in wild elephant attack in Kozhikode
content: According to the police, Santha and Sanika were chased by the elephant while they were on their way to a nearby field with their cows

title: Arya Vaidya Sala trustee Raghava Varier passes away
content: Varier is survived by wife Lakshmi Varasiar, son P.R. Ramesh, and daughter Usha. The funeral took place at Kottakkal

title: Special trains from Cherlapalli to Tirupati
content: SCR has shifted several trains to Cherlapalli because of the ongoing Secunderabad station redeveloped works

title: Agniveer recruitment rally at 1 EME Centre in Secunderabad on August 1
content: Applicants must be between 17½ and 21 years of age, with birth dates falling between October 1, 2004, and April 1, 2008

title: Air India Ahmedabad plane crash: U.S. Golden Chassis helped AAIB download raw data from black box
content: AAIB said the Golden Chassis or the identical EAFR unit and download cables required to download data from EAFR were sourced from the U.S. National Transport Safety Board (NTSB)

title: Primary teachers in Andhra Pradesh seek payment of pending arrears
content: The government must constitute Pay Revision Commission and announce Interim Relief without further delay, says A.P. Primary Teachers Association

title: Wife living separately from husband without valid reason not entitled to maintenance: Allahabad HC
content: The counsel for the petitioner submitted that the trial court has recorded the finding that the wife is living separately from her husband without sufficient reasons

title: The peopling of the Indian subcontinent
content: According to the 2011 Census, inter-caste marriages were about 6% and inter-faith ones about 1%. It is likely these numbers will have risen significantly when the forthcoming 2027 Census offers the numbers

title: EAM Jaishankar to tour Singapore, China from July 13
content: In Singapore, Mr. Jaishankar will meet his counterpart and the leadership of the country as part of the regular exchanges between the two sides.

title: Five Municipal Corporations in A.P. win Swachh Survekshan Awards 2025
content: The civic bodies in Vijayawada, Guntur and Tirupati grab the award in population category, while Vizag and Rajahmundry win in ministerial category

title: Foreign Medical Graduates get relief as A.P. High Court asks APMC to issue PR to appellant
content: APMC shall grant PR to the appellant as he has completed the one-year mandatory internship as specified in CRMI Regulations, 2021, says Division Bench

title: Jagan accuses Naidu of suppressing dissent with State machinery
content: The fundamental democratic process is being crushed under the weight of an authoritarian regime, alleges the YSRCP chief

title: A.P. Endowments Minister discusses TTD staff issues with Trust Board
content: Renovation works have been sanctioned for over 200 temples, utilising the Common Good Fund, says Ramanarayana Reddy

title: BJP MP’s remarks on pregnant woman’s demand for motorable road to village in M.P. stir row
content: Rajesh Mishra courted controversy after accusing the woman from his constituency of seeking social media fame, while also offering to make arrangements for her delivery

title: How is Mizoram handling the refugee crisis?
content: Who are the Chins? What led to the fresh inflow? What ties does the dominant Mizo community of Mizoram share with the Chins of Myanmar, the Bawms of Bangladesh, and the Kuki-Zos of Manipur? How are foreigners identified in the State?

title: Air India says will review preliminary plane crash report with pilots
content: Initial report an important step in identifying factors and ensuring prevention measures, says AI’s communication

title: What is the state of inequality in India?
content: Why is calculating the actual level of income and wealth inequality in India extremely difficult? What are the methods? Does the picture of low and falling inequality as outlined by the World Bank characterise the current reality of India? Where is wealth concentrated in India?

title: ICG, Japan Coast Guard conclude joint exercise ‘JA-MATA’ off Chennai coast
content: The ship undertook this visit to gain exposure to international maritime operations and enhance cooperation between the Indian Coast Guard (ICG) and JCG, says ICG

title: One more Nipah case in Kerala as patient dies at Perinthalmanna hospital
content: The man hailing from Kumaramputhur, near Mannarkkad, in Palakkad district was under treatment at the hospital for fever-related ailments

title: Rain brings respite from heat in Vellore, nearby districts
content: Tiruvannamalai district receives the highest amount of rain since Thursday night, with 19.20 mm, followed by Tirupattur with 13.10 mm

title: Police deny permission to J&K parties, including NC, to visit slain civilians’ graveyard of 1931 uprising in Srinagar
content: Any violation of these orders shall invite strict legal action under relevant provisions of law, the police has warned; several regional parties had sought permission to be allowed to visit the graveyard located on the premises of Naqsband Sahib shrine in the old city

title: Switch on Kaleshwaram PHs to protect wilting crops: Harish
content: The BRS leader seeks to know from the govt. how Medigadda is handling over 8 lakh cusecs flood if it’s collapsed

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Where LSU fits after landing Lamar Brown
content: no. 1 overall prospect Lamar Brown commits to play for the LSU Tigers . 15 of the teams in the current top 25 secured at least one ESPN 300 commitment . Alabama is on the rise by adding multiple four-star (or better) prospects .

title: Sivaganga custodial death: CBI registers FIR against police
content: Central agency files case under Section 103 (punishment for murder) of BNS; six police personnel of the special team that thrashed the youth were suspended and five among them were subsequently arrested by the State’s CB-CID

title: Maintain soft approach towards Nitish Kumar but target BJP leaders, Tejashwi tells INDIA bloc leaders
content: Latest round of INDIA bloc meeting held in Patna; after meeting, Mr. Yadav posted a message on his social media account saying the INDIA bloc talks were meaningful and positive

title: DMK will remain in power with absolute majority, says Vaiko
content: He say the question of a coalition government will not arise as the people of the State will not accept such an idea

title: The preliminary report on the AI 171 crash is notably brief and lacking in technical transparency, says aviation expert
content: The 33-page Ethiopian Airlines ET 302 preliminary report, for example, included extensive data traces, CVR excerpts, checklists, and manufacturer bulletins, enabling stakeholders worldwide to act swiftly, says Amit Singh, pilot and founder of the NGO Safety Matters

title: Enforcement Directorate attaches assets worth ₹762.47 crore in PACL case
content: ‘PACL misappropriated about ₹48,000 crore from investors through deceptive schemes’, according to the agency

title: In novel initiative, coconut farmers in Pollachi deploy climate sensors to explore alternative crops
content: Driven by the growing threat of Root Wilt Disease affecting their crop, coconut farmers of the Pollachi region in Coimbatore  district have deployed a technology-based field monitoring system to record climatic conditions and assess crop suitability

title: Kolhapuri chappal row: Prada to launch capsule collection of ‘Made in India’ sandals with local artisans in Maharashtra
content: Prada to send technical expert team to the State next week, says Maharashtra Chamber of Commerce, Industry and Agriculture; describes it as a “significant win for community recognition and inclusion in global design platforms”

title: Debts increased under DMK regime: Edappadi K. Palaniswami
content: He says the DMK had availed itself of loan worth ₹5.38 lakh cr. ever since it assumed power, despite not having implemented any major projects

title: Congress welcomes Supreme Court order on proof of identity in Bihar SIR
content: These proofs of identity roughly covered 90% of the people who could be affected by the SIR exercise, said Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi, who also argued the case before the Supreme Court

title: UGC’s anti-ragging system has utterly failed, says Delhi High Court
content: Court mulls suo motu PIL petition to check the surge in ragging episodes and student suicides; UGC’s anti-ragging helpline recorded 1,084 complaints in 2024, the highest in nine years

title: Election Commission of India says 80% of electors in Bihar have submitted voter enumeration forms
content: The forms can be submitted till July 25 and the required documents are allowed till August 30, says poll panel in ongoing Special Intensive Revision

title: Over 1,500 Maoists have surrendered in Chhattisgarh in last 15 months, says Chief Minister
content: In a post on X, CM Vishnu Deo Sai says 1,521 Naxals have surrendered and called it ‘a strong indicator of the increasing reach and trust of the government in the Naxal-affected regions’

title: Odisha student battling for life following self-immolation, says sexual assault complaint against professor went unheard
content: Assistant professor Samir Kumar Sahu heading the education department in Fakir Mohan Autonomous College in Balasore district was arrested while principal of the college Dilip Ghosh was placed under suspension

title: Take active part in Special Intensive Revision, appeals Bihar Chief Electoral Officer
content: Expressing concern, the senior election officer said the participation of voters in urban areas was relatively lower than in rural areas

title: Amit Shah offers prayers at Rajarajeswara Temple amid tight security
content: After offering prayers at the temple, he returned to the airport by 6.45 p.m. and departed for New Delhi at 7.15 p.m

title: 500 issues in 44 years, a testament to a tiny magazine’s resilience, literary excellence
content: Writers and readers gather in Malappuram to celebrate Innu magazine’s journey, which began in 1981 and earned a Limca Record as India’s longest-running little magazine

title: ED attaches assets worth ₹681.54 crore in Ramprastha Promoters & Developers case
content: Projects such as Project Edge, Project Skyz, Project Rise, and Ramprastha City were launched between 2008 and 2011, but possession has not been handed over even after 14 to 17 years

title: Centre moves Supreme Court to review ruling on IPS deputation in CAPFs
content: Ministry seeks reconsideration of order directing phased reduction of IPS officers in senior CAPF posts within two years

title: Karnataka Congress needs more than holding OBC meet here to woo the communities to party, say activists
content: Setting aside the earlier caste census, apparently under pressure from the politically dominant Veerashaiva-Lingayats and Vokkaligas, is viewed as a failure of the Congress government’s OBC politics in Karnataka

title: Visit forts of Maratha Military Landscapes which made it to UNESCO list: PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister urges Indians to visit UNESCO-listed Maratha forts, showcasing military strength and cultural pride

title: ED attaches assets worth ₹588.57 crore in Amtek Auto Limited case
content: Among the entities purportedly linked to the case are ARG Limited, ACIL Limited, Metalyst Forging Limited, and Castex Technologies Limited, along with promoter Arvind Dham and others.

title: Echoes of empowerment: ‘Penkaalangal’ resonates at National Percussion Festival
content: The second day of the percussion festival began with a stirring Panchari Melam performance led by Therozhi Ramakuruppu

title: Andhra Pradesh government is neglecting Srikakulam district, alleges Dharmana
content: Not even ₹1,000 crore has been allocated for pending irrigation and development projects in the district, he says

title: Ensure justice reaches the last and most needy citizen: CJI Gavai
content: Justice Gavai unveiled a special postal cover titled ‘Babasaheb Dr. B.R. Ambedkar – Constituent Assembly – Constitution of India’ along with a set of picture postcards

title: Trailblazer in ghatam now hears beats of success
content: India’s first woman ghatam maestro Sukanya Ramgopal recalls her rebellious journey. In the process, she pulled the instrument out of the shadows.

title: A shot in the dark
content: Industrialist Gopal Khemka was shot dead in Patna, seven years after the family lost a son — also to murder. As the family grieves, politics is at play with Opposition members and others from the NDA that the Chief Minister is a part of, lashing out at the Bihar government over deteriorating law and order, finds Amit Bhelari

title: Ramadoss tells cadre he’s the boss; Anbumani asks them to intensify membership drive
content: Ahead of the PMK stepping into its 37th year and celebrating its founding day on July 16, both leaders are wooing the cadre, hoping that they will decisively mobilise behind them and end the current leadership tussle

title: Officials deploy NDRF and SDRF teams in Eluru district as Godavari river swells
content: Over 900 families impacted as floodwaters rise; evacuation from cut-off villages ordered due to overflowing Yeddu Vaagu, says Jangareddygudem RDO

title: CPI demands disbanding of NTA, reforms in wildlife law
content: Resolution passed at the four-day district conference of the party at Irinjalakuda condemned repeated irregularities and alleged large-scale corruption in exams conducted by the NTA, claiming that the agency operated with no transparency or accountability

title: Startup demonstrates delivery of goods by large cargo drone in Tiruchi school
content: The drone, powered by an onboard battery and a payload of 6 kg, soared high at a speed of 100 km. It is developed by Amber Wings, an entity of The ePlane Company, the start-up incubated by IIT-M
